intro: Spilanthes arnicoides, commonly known as the Mexican mint or devil's breath, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small clusters of tiny flowers. The plant has hairy, aromatic leaves and produces yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Spilanthes arnicoides is also known for its peppery taste and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
